comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "John Francis Count McCormack (14 June 1884 – 16 September 1945) was a world-famous Irish tenor, celebrated for his performances of the operatic and popular song repertoires, and renowned for his diction and breath control. He was also a Papal Count." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_McCormack_%28tenor%29

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Listen to him at commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?title=File%3AKeep_the_H... Ads for concerts in various papers suggest that he was in the U.S. from January to April 1916.

comment.author: 35607158@N06
comment._content: Looks like him www.bach-cantatas.com/Pic-Bio-BIG/McCormack-John-6.jpg That looks an awful lot like a Hudson's Bay coat that he is wearing.
